greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows, based on a simple Fibonacci recursion rule.
comment: Subdiagonal is A000071(n+3). Row sums of inverse are 0^n.
Row sums are given by A135934 - _Emanuele Munarini_, Dec 05 2017
formula: Number triangle T(n, k)=T(n-1, k-1)+F(k+1)*T(n-1, k) where F(n)=A000045(n); Column k has g.f. x^k/Product(1-F(j+1)x, j, 0, k).
mathematica: Grid[RecurrenceTable[{F[n,k] == F[n-1,k-1] + Fibonacci[k+1] F[n-1,k], F[0,k] == KroneckerDelta[k]}, F, {n,0,10}, {k,0,10}]] (* _Emanuele Munarini_, Dec 05 2017 *)
results.author: _Gary W. Adamson_, Aug 14 2005
